results.headline: Out of Prison, Back in the Life
results.summary_short: “Friend 2: The Legacy,” a sequel to a popular gangster tale in South Korea, is full of nods to “The Godfather: Part II.”

results.headline: Doctor, Cellist, Clown, Humanitarian
results.summary_short: The documentary “Beatocello’s Umbrella” focuses on Dr. Beat Richner and his efforts to fund his hospitals for children in Cambodia.

results.headline: The Disaster Is Over, but the Effects on a Nation Are Not
results.summary_short: “Nuclear Nation” chronicles the effects of the earthquake, tsunami and power plant disaster that devastated parts of Japan in 2011.

results.headline: A Zebra of a Different Color, or Another Pattern
results.summary_short: The animated “Khumba” tells a tale of outcasts, including a South African zebra who’s striped on only half of his body.

results.headline: Melancholy Odyssey Through the Folk Scene
results.summary_short: “Inside Llewyn Davis” is an intoxicating, somewhat surreal ramble through the Greenwich Village folk scene in 1961.

results.headline: After Great Loss, a Sexual Feeling Comes
results.summary_short: As Christmas approaches, a woman manages mourning through experimentation.

results.headline: Warring Emotions Play Out in a Universe Torn by Conflict
results.summary_short: “Twice Born” features Penélope Cruz in a drama that uses the 1990s Balkans as a backdrop.

results.headline: Mars Mission Is Uneventful Till the Undead Feel Unwell
results.summary_short: In “The Last Days on Mars,” hours before a six-month research mission is about to end, an exhausted crew is about to head home until a startling discovery.

results.headline: The New Girl, in Proverbial Pursuit of Popularity
results.summary_short: In “S#x Acts,” set in Tel Aviv, a new high school student longing to be accepted has serial sexual encounters with a pack of popular predatory boys.

results.headline: Good Samaritan Ensnared in a Web With No Exit
results.summary_short: In the Australian thriller “Swerve,” a fatal car accident draws a passer-by into intrigue with a femme fatale and a briefcase full of money.

results.headline: Coal in Your Stocking? How About a Murderer in Your B&B?
results.summary_short: “Merry Christmas” has actors improvising a murder mystery tale set in a bed-and-breakfast.

results.headline: The Singer’s Bohemia, and His New Legal Practice
results.summary_short: In “Live at the Foxes Den,” Jackson Rathbone of the “Twilight” movies plays a lawyer who quits his job to sing in a run-down club.

results.headline: The N.B.A. Prospect, After the Chance Is Gone
results.summary_short: The documentary “Lenny Cooke” traces the title figure, a basketball star whose supposed destiny never came to pass.

results.headline: Look at How Exciting My Life Is!
results.summary_short: In “Night Train to Lisbon,” a stuffy academic undergoes a late midlife crisis, impulsively abandoning his comfortable post as a teacher of classical studies in Switzerland.

results.headline: A Home School Where the Lessons Are Subtle
results.summary_short: In “Breakfast With Curtis,” a home-schooled teenager comes out of his shell in a neighborhood with many bohemians.

results.headline: Macho Hero and His Sidekick Shoot ’Em Up in a Crooked India
results.summary_short: “Bullett Raja,” directed by Tigmanshu Dhulia, bounces around but always keeps an eye on the object of its affection, Raja Mish, played by Saif Ali Khan.

results.headline: The High Road Through a Struggle Is Never Easy to Navigate
